title: [$250] Excessive API Calls When Typing in Vacation Delegate Search Field (Missing Debounce)

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.78-3 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @iwiznia **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Quality](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1765823653921669) ## Action Performed: 1. Navigate to Account > Profile > Status > Vacation delegate 2. Click into the delegate search/email input field 3. Begin typing an email address slowly 4. Observe network activity ## Expected Result: Search-related API calls should be debounced or throttled. ## Actual Result: SendPerformanceTiming is called once per keystroke SearchForReports is called once per keystroke A large volume of unnecessary API requests is generated. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9455a94c-3c9c-49c1-977c-d162d9613156 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.78-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2379/folder/13176924/41237548/1073533943?p=2 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+vq@applause.expensifail.com leungbratt6@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** Windows 11/Chrome **App Component:** User Settings ## Action Performed: 1. Open the Newdot app on the Main device (or browser) 2. Enter the Gmail account and click the Continue button 3. Secondary environment (or incognito mode), enter the Expensifail account in the Email field 4. Click the Continue button 5. Copy the magic link of the Expensifail account 6. Open a new tab in the main device of Gmail account (or browser) 7. Past the link and edit with staging to the link ## Expected Result: An error message displays when the wrong magic link is input ## Actual Result: No error message, the app logs in to the Expensifail account from the Gmail account device and vice versa ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/18ee949c-ccfe-454a-a439-dcfde3cba987 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.78-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** N/A **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** iPhone 15 iOS 26.1, MacBook Air Chrome **App Component:** Search ## Action Performed: 1. Sign in to ND 2. Go to Reports tab, select Chats on LHN 3. Click Has dropdown filter, select Link, apply - search query shows "type:chat has:link" 4. Click Type dropdown filter, select Expense, apply - search query shows "type:expense has:link", "Something went wrong" page appears ## Expected Result: "Something went wrong" page is not shown ## Actual Result: "Something went wrong" page is shown when applied filter in chats and changed type to expense. The search query shows type:expense has:link. The same issue happens, if apply Has filter for expense and change the type dropdown to chat ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/95e55d2c-4701-410d-9340-3aeca33d54a7 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.78-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/76998 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** snoidjsoijosijnoidsjo@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution **Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Bug 1: Precondition: - Submission frequency is set to Instantly. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create two expenses. 4. Go to Reports > Reports (optional). 5. Open the report. 6. Select two expenses via checkbox. 7. Click More > Reject. 8. Enter reason and click Reject expenses. Bug 2: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create an expense. 4. Go to Reports > Reports. 5. Open expense report. 6. Click on the header > Delete expense. 7. Delete the expense. ## Expected Result: RHP will close. ## Actual Result: Not here page opens after rejecting expenses/deleting expense. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/be0b5c0b-180f-4265-953f-bda9e4b03db6 https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9f11bb7f-ab6b-4031-8483-40f4dde69f84 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
